intro: Malacothrix saxatilis var. implicata, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
